chapter.title: Overview
chapter.para: This document describes the Rackspace Cloud Identity Service API v2.0 which is Rackspace's implementation of the OpenStack Keystone Identity Service v2.0. The service performs authentication, generating a token in response to valid credentials, and authorization, providing access to services based on roles and policies assigned to accounts, users, and groups.

Version 1.1 of this API, known as Rackspace Cloud Authentication Service only provides authentication capabilities and cannot be used for authorization . However, you can use an authentication token generated from the v1.1 API in calls to the V2.0 API.

section.title: Intended Audience
section.para: This document is intended for Rackspace software developers interested in developing applications that utilize the Keystone Identity Admin API for authentication. The Rackspace Cloud Identity Service, also known as the authentication service or "Auth", allows these developers to obtain an authentication token and a list of regional service endpoints to the various Rackspace services available.
To use this Developer Guide most effectively, readers should be familiar with ReSTful web services, HTTP/1.1, and JSON and/or XML serialization formats.

section.title: Additional Resources
section.para: Descriptive information about this service is also published in its Web Application Description Language (WADL) and XML Schema Definition (XSD). You are welcome to read this information, but please use the appropriate US-based or UK-based version.

A customer's account may be based in either the US or the UK; this is not determined by the customer's physical location but by the location of the Rackspace retail site which was used to create that account:

listitem.para:
If an account was created via http://www.rackspacecloud.com, it is a US-based account.
The US-based WADL is
http://docs.rackspace.com/auth/api/v2.0/auth.wadl.
The US-based XSDs are
http://docs.rackspace.com/auth/api/v2.0/common/xsd/api.xsd and
http://docs.rackspace.com/auth/api/v2.0/common/xsd/api-common.xsd.

If an account was created via http://www.rackspace.co.uk, it is a UK-based account.
The UK-based WADL is
http://docs.rackspace.com/auth/api/uk/v2.0/auth.wadl.
The UK-based XSDs are
http://docs.rackspace.com/auth/api/uk/v2.0/common/xsd/api.xsd and
http://docs.rackspace.com/auth/api/uk/v2.0/common/xsd/api-common.xsd.

section.para: If you are unsure how an account was created, use the Rackspace contact information at either site to ask for help.
In addition to this API documentation and its related WADLs and XSDs, you might find relevant information in several other places:

listitem.para:
To see how the Cloud Authentication Service is used by another Rackspace service, read that service's API documentation at
docs.rackspace.com. You might also find useful articles and tutorials in the Rackspace Knowledge Center at rackspace.com/knowledge_center/.

To learn about v1.1 of the Cloud Authentication Service, which supports Rackspace authentication but does not implement the OpenStack Keystone Identity Service, read the Rackspace Cloud Authentication Client Developer Guide for API v1.1 at
http://docs.rackspace.com/auth/api/v1.1/auth-client-devguide-latest.pdf.

To learn about Keystone, read OpenStack's Keystone documentation at
keystone.openstack.org.
To connect with Rackspace customers and others who are interested in discussing the same things that you are interested in, visit the Rackspace Open Cloud Community at community.rackspace.com.

tip.para: For Rackspace-internal use only: Check the Cloud Authentication and Identity wiki pages, beginning at one.rackspace.com/display/auth/, for very current operational information. This wiki also contains some step-by-step guidance on commonly-performed procedures. For example, the Create New Service Users in Auth page outlines creation of service users (identity:admin users) for Auth 1.0, 1.1, and 2.0.
